page.title: 17Spencer's Farm, Micklebring
page.content: This is a{300 acre}farm with{cattle {crops}and{machines. CROPS-}There are{ {100}acres of{corn, barley and wheat. {27}acres of{oilseed rape, 12}acres of {potatoes, 10}acres of{peas, 10 acres of{kale, 81}acres of{grassland. 60 tons of{barley}are kept for{cattle {feed. ANIMALS- 120 cattle-}calves bought at 3 weeks old, fattened and sold at two years for beef. They are {Friesians.}Mr Spencer sells them at Doncaster cattle market.{120 sheep (ewes) with{200 lambs,}again sold for food.{FARMYARD- 2 geese, 20 hens, 2 {dogs, cats, 2 riding horses,}and{1 {Shetland pony.}Horses were used for all farmwork up to 1940 when the first tractor was bought.{MACHINERY-}farming is easier than it used to be; machines have taken over the hard work. Mr. Spencer needs only 3 men to work the farm and 30 years ago he needed 7 men.
